byline.contributor: Nicola Clark contributed reporting from Paris.
byline.original: By ERICA GOODE and JAD MOUAWAD

abstract: Crash of Germanwings Flight 9525 and revelation that co-pilot Andreas Lubitz had mental illness that he kept hidden from his employer raises questions about whether policies governing pilots with mental health issues are effective; experts say authorities should focus on improving hiring and screening process of pilots.
lead_paragraph: Aviation experts say that most screening programs in Europe and the United States are based on an honor system that relies on pilots volunteering information about their mental health.

headline.main: Germanwings Crash Raises Questions About Shifting Ideas of Pilot Fitness
headline.print_headline: Too Ill to Fly? Shifting Ideas of Pilot Fitness
